French debt to Great Britain and Young plan on German reparation

16 Jul 1929

C5394 17 JUL 1929 126 From FRANCE. Telegram from Sir W.Tyrrell (Paris). D., July 16th 1929. R. 11.15 a.m. July 17th 1929. No.92. BY BAG. My telegram No. 91 of July 12th. 2. After dealing on July 11th and the morning of July 12th with the American debt agreement and the question of reserves in connexion with the ratification thereof, (and by implication with that of the British debt agreements) the President of the Council explained to the Chamber of Deputies on July lath the history of the British war debt and the Churchill-Caillaux agree- ment of July 12th, 1926. Monsieur Poincaré pointed out that the sum total of the debt as fixed on July 12th 1926, amounted to 653,127,900 pounds sterling. "The present value of the 62 annuities payable under the Caillaux-Churchill agreement represents 341,300,000 pounds sterling at 3%, 258,000,000 pounds sterling at 4.25% and 223,000,000 pounds sterling at 5%". he emphasised also the maintenance in the July 1926 agreement of the theory of the Balfour note.
